required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study in Healthy Young Women to Investigate the Pharmacodynamics, Pharmacokinetics and Safety of Vilaprisan
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group, Multi-center Study to Investigate the Pharmacodynamics, Pharmacokinetics and Safety After Daily Oral Administration of 4 Different Doses of Vilaprisan (BAY1002670) in Healthy Women of Reproductive Age

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study in healthy women of reproductive age to investigate the pharmacodynamics (mainly ovarian activity), pharmacokinetics and safety of vilaprisan after daily oral administration of 4 different doses over 84 days, using a randomized, parallel-group, multicenter design.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Hoogland score during treatment, day 9 to day 28
primary_outcome.description: based on maximum size of follicle-like structures, estradiol and progesterone serum concentrations

primary_outcome.measure: Hoogland score during treatment, day 63 to day 84
primary_outcome.description: based on maximum size of follicle-like structures, estradiol and progesterone serum concentrations

primary_outcome.measure: Hoogland score during follow up cycle 1
primary_outcome.description: based on maximum size of follicle-like structures, estradiol and progesterone serum concentrations

primary_outcome.measure: Hoogland score during follow up cycle 2
primary_outcome.description: based on maximum size of follicle-like structures, estradiol and progesterone serum concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: Exposure-response analysis of vilaprisan by population pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic modeling
Number of subjects with TEAEs (treatment-emergent adverse events)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After three month treatment and during follow-up (up to 60 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with PAEC (progesterone-receptor-modulator associated endometrial changes)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After three month treatment and during follow-up (up to 60 days)

arm_group.description: 0.5 mg BAY1002670, oral administration, one tablet to be taken daily, 84 consecutive days
1 mg BAY1002670, oral administration, one tablet to be taken daily, 84 consecutive days
2 mg BAY1002670, oral administration, one tablet to be taken daily, 84 consecutive days
4 mg BAY1002670, oral administration, one tablet to be taken daily, 84 consecutive days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI): ≥ 18 and ≤ 32 kg/m² at the first screening visit
- Absence of clinically relevant abnormal findings in the pre-treatment endometrial biopsy
- Pre-treatment cycle assessed as ovulatory and not longer than 44 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incompletely cured pre-existing diseases for which it can be assumed that the absorption, distribution, metabolism, elimination or effects of the study drugs will not be normal
- Known or suspected liver disorders
- Amenorrhea for more than 3 months within the last 6 months before the first screening examination
- Clinically relevant findings (e.g. blood pressure, electrocardiogram [ECG], physical and gynecological examination, laboratory examination)
- Positive urine pregnancy test
- Regular use of medicines
